Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately illustrate healthy, growing plants that have enough water and light.
The student can depict wilted or poorly growing plants that lack water, showing clear differences from healthy plants.
The student can illustrate plants without light as unable to grow properly, possibly with stretched stems and yellowing leaves.
The student can use their drawings to show patterns indicating that both water and light are essential for plant growth.
The student may also attempt to label parts of the plant or include captions that describe the impact of water and light, with mostly correct terminology.
CANNOT: The student may have minor gaps in labeling certain plant features or effects, such as not labeling every part despite understanding them otherwise.
The student may occasionally overlook fine details such as differentiating soil moisture levels, though the overall concept is still clearly presented.
